com.projetloki.genesis

Class MediaQuery

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.projetloki.genesis.MediaCondition
      • com.projetloki.genesis.MediaQuery

  • public abstract class MediaQuery
extends MediaCondition
    A media type, and possibly one or more expressions (media features), which resolve to either true or false. The result of the query is true if the media type specified in the media query matches the type of device the document is being displayed on and all expressions in the media query are true.

    Several media queries can be combined with the or operator. The result is a media condition.

    Media queries are immutable.

    Author:
    Cl√©ment Roux
    See Also:
    MDN

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static MediaQuery ALL
      Suitable for all devices.
      static MediaQuery BRAILLE
      Intended for braille tactile feedback devices.
      static MediaQuery EMBOSSED
      Intended for paged braille printers.
      static MediaQuery HANDHELD
      Intended for handheld devices (typically small screen, limited bandwidth).
      static MediaQuery PRINT
      Intended for paged material and for documents viewed on screen in print preview mode.
      static MediaQuery PROJECTION
      Intended for projected presentations, for example projectors.
      static MediaQuery SCREEN
      Intended primarily for color computer screens.
      static MediaQuery SPEECH
      Intended for speech synthesizers.
      static MediaQuery TTY
      Intended for media using a fixed-pitch character grid (such as teletypes, terminals, or portable devices with limited display capabilities).
      static MediaQuery TV
      Intended for television-type devices (low resolution, color, limited-scrollability screens, sound available).

      Returns a media condition that evaluates to true if and only if this query evaluates to false.

      • TTY

        public static final MediaQuery TTY
        Intended for media using a fixed-pitch character grid (such as teletypes, terminals, or portable devices with limited display capabilities). Authors should not use pixel units with the 'tty' media type.

      • TV

        public static final MediaQuery TV
        Intended for television-type devices (low resolution, color, limited-scrollability screens, sound available).

    • Method Detail

      • and

        @PoorBrowserSupport
public MediaQuery and(MediaFeature feature)
        Returns a new media query that evaluates to true if both this query and the given media feature do.

      • not

        @PoorBrowserSupport
public MediaCondition not()
        Returns a media condition that evaluates to true if and only if this query evaluates to false.
        See Also:
        MDN

      • onlyIfFeaturesAreSupported

        public MediaCondition onlyIfFeaturesAreSupported()
        Returns a media condition that evaluates to true if this query does and the browser supports media features. Prevents older browsers that do not support media queries with media features from applying styles.
        See Also:
        MDN, Browser support

        public String toString()
